result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose C Mariscal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court waived all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to low income.

If Day Reporting Center is not applicable, Court allows defendant to serve sentence on Electronic Monitoring, only if in AODA or Drug Treatment. Defense counsel to provide verification to the Court.

If defendant does not attend AODA or Drug Treatment, sentence to be served in the House of Correction, with Huber privileges for work search and treatment.
To be served at the Day Reporting Center.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose C Mariscal in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jose C Mariscal in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered the defendant to serve 7 MONTHS and 18 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 18 days time served, to be served at the Day Reporting Center.

-If Day Reporting Center is not applicable, Court allows defendant to serve sentence on Electronic Monitoring, only if in AODA or Drug Treatment. Defense counsel to provide verification to the Court.
 
-If defendant does not attend AODA or Drug Treatment, sentence to be served in the House of Correction, with Huber privileges for work search and treatment. 

-Court waived all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to low income. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Jose C Mariscal in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jose C Mariscal in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Jose C Mariscal not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted a quick Plea and Sentencing date. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court via telephone, defendant Jose C Mariscal not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for a bail/bond hearing.
No parties available for today's proceedings.
Case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 47.
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with PICK N' SAVE, 5851 S PACKARD AVE., CUDAHY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jose C Mariscal in court with attorney Kathleen Judith Osvat.  Defendant Jose C Mariscal in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Case is adjourned to BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 47.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file.  ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Defendant Jose C Mariscal in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the Pick 'n Save located at 5851 South Packard Avenue, in the City of Cudahy, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

Defendant Jose C Mariscal in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jose C Mariscal
Current: 421 Southtown Place, #EE204, South Milwaukee, WI 53172   (Effective: 02-03-2015)
Prior: 421 Southtown Place #ee204, South Milwaukee, WI 53172
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/3/15 @ 1:30pm
